reviews.review_msg: Eldar was a great prof! Definitely would love to take another class with him. Doesn't use the textbook or even blackboard so you must go to class but then all the exams are based solely on his notes which is nice. Fast at emailing you back if you have any  questions and his lectures are interesting because he engages with the class a lot.

I took Principles of Microeconomics and Principles of Macroeconomics in 2018W. That was an excellent experience. Dr. Hasan integrated a lot of interesting real-life cases with knowledge points. I applied what I learned during my internship in investment banking, connecting different economic information to give in-depth analysis and recommendations

Dr. Hasan is enthusiastic and caring. While he goes off on tangents or tells irrelevant stories at times, they're generally funny and add to the class atmosphere. Participation matters as there are iclickers. He genuinely cares about students, respects mental-health, and makes up for lost lectures by doing them online.

Posts his notes online, but attending he may give some hints and tips that might be useful, good joker and enjoyable lecutre, some homework but manageable, great guy.... says clear a lot so if you cant stand people repeating words then maybe dont attend the lecture i guess
He's a very chilled and funny guy but hard to understand him so READ THE TEXTBOOK. He's one of the few professors who truly want you to achieve by giving you several chances to bring your mark up!
